newsitem.title: UK: Soccer star Palmer found guilty of indecent assault.
newsitem.headline: Soccer star Palmer found guilty of indecent assault.

text.p: Former England soccer star Carlton Palmer was found guilty on Tuesday of indecently assaulting an 18-year-old woman while he was out drinking with team mates.
Palmer, 31, had denied putting his hand between the teenager's legs and making obscene comments in a crowded bar in the northern English city of Leeds.

The Leeds United player was fined 600 pounds ($978) and ordered to pay 338 pounds costs. Magistrate David Loy said he had taken into account the impact the conviction could have on Palmer's career when setting the fine, but added; "it was a very unpleasant incident indeed."
Palmer's lawyers said he would appeal against the conviction.
